name: Yggdrasil - The World Tree

etymology.derivation: Yggr (Odin's name) + drasill (horse) = the tree Odin 'rode' when hanging for nine nights

description: The immense cosmic ash tree at the center of Norse cosmology, connecting all Nine Realms from roots to crown. Home to gods, humans, giants, elves, dwarves, and the dead. Constantly gnawed by Nidhogg (dragon), watered by Norns, visited by Odin's ravens, and will fall at Ragnar칬k.

cosmology.structure: Ash tree of cosmic proportions with three roots and three wells
cosmology.threeLevels: Upper (Asgard, Vanaheim, Alfheim), Middle (Midgard, Jotunheim, Svartalfheim, Nidavellir), Lower (Helheim, Niflheim, Muspelheim)

threeRoots.firstRoot: Extends to Asgard - Well of Urd (Norns' well of fate)
threeRoots.secondRoot: Extends to Jotunheim - Mimir's Well (wisdom and knowledge)
threeRoots.thirdRoot: Extends to Niflheim - Hvergelmir (roaring cauldron, source of all rivers)

threeWells.wellOfUrd: Norns water Yggdrasil's roots daily, determine fate of all beings
threeWells.mimirWell: Odin sacrificed eye for drink of wisdom from this well
threeWells.hvergelmir: Primordial spring where Nidhogg gnaws roots, source of rivers of existence

inhabitants.eagle: Unnamed eagle perches in highest branches, surveys all worlds
inhabitants.vedrfolnir: Hawk sits between eagle's eyes, sees all
inhabitants.ratatosk: Squirrel runs up and down trunk carrying insults between eagle and Nidhogg
inhabitants.fourStags: Dain, Dvalin, Duneyr, Durathror - eat foliage, represent four winds
inhabitants.nidhogg: Dragon gnaws at roots from below, tries to fell tree
inhabitants.norns: Three sisters of fate water roots and shape destiny

mythologicalEvents.odinsVigil: Odin hung himself on Yggdrasil nine nights, pierced by spear, to gain runes
mythologicalEvents.runicRevelation: Runes revealed to Odin during his hanging ordeal
mythologicalEvents.mimirSacrifice: Odin gave eye at Mimir's well beneath Yggdrasil for wisdom
mythologicalEvents.ragnarok: Yggdrasil will shake violently but survive world's ending
mythologicalEvents.rebirth: Tree endures Ragnar칬k, shelters Lif and Lifthrasir (new humanity)

shamanicSignificance.worldAxis: Vertical shamanic axis for ascending to heaven or descending to underworld
shamanicSignificance.odinsJourney: Odin's nine-night hanging = shamanic death and rebirth initiation
shamanicSignificance.runeQuest: Ultimate shamanic ordeal gaining cosmic wisdom
shamanicSignificance.seidrTravel: V칬lvas and shamans journey along Yggdrasil between realms
shamanicSignificance.ancestorConnection: Tree connects living with ancestors and yet-to-be-born

sacredSignificance: Yggdrasil = existence itself. All Nine Realms exist within/upon tree. While tree lives, cosmos endures. Odin's sacrifice on Yggdrasil = supreme act of wisdom-seeking. Tree embodies interconnection of all life, fate, time, and space.
symbolicMeanings: Roots = past, ancestors, deep unconscious, underworld
Trunk = present, Midgard, everyday reality, humans
Branches = future, gods, higher consciousness, heaven
Constant gnawing = entropy, time, decay threatening existence
Daily watering = maintenance, care, renewal, choice
Eagle and dragon = cosmic duality, upper and lower, spirit and matter
Ratatosk = communication, discord, connection between extremes
Endurance through Ragnar칬k = eternal nature of cosmic structure

nineRealms.asgard: Realm of Aesir gods - upper branches
nineRealms.vanaheim: Realm of Vanir gods - upper roots/branches
nineRealms.alfheim: Realm of light elves - upper regions
nineRealms.svartalfheim: Realm of dark elves - below surface
nineRealms.niflheim: Realm of ice and mist - roots in primordial cold
nineRealms.muspelheim: Realm of fire - roots in primordial flame
nineRealms.helheim: Realm of the dead - deep roots (sometimes counted separately from Niflheim)

modernInterpretations.jungian: Collective unconscious, Self, wholeness, individuation journey
modernInterpretations.ecological: Web of life, interconnection of all ecosystems, earth system
modernInterpretations.spiritual: Meditation on cosmic interconnection, shamanic world-walking

culturalContext: Central image of Norse cosmology preserved in Poetic Edda (V칬lusp치, Gr칤mnism치l) and Prose Edda. World tree concept appears across many cultures (Cosmic Tree archetype). Vikings understood existence as interconnected through Yggdrasil. Modern Heathenry maintains Yggdrasil cosmology.
primarySources: Gr칤mnism치l - details of Nine Realms, wells, inhabitants
Gylfaginning (Prose Edda) - Snorri's compilation of Yggdrasil lore
ritualUses: Meditation on Nine Realms - journey through cosmic structure
Rune work - connecting to Odin's rune revelation
Ancestor veneration - connecting through roots to those who came before
Seeking wisdom - following Odin's example of sacrifice for knowledge
safetyWarnings: Yggdrasil is mythological/cosmological concept, not physical plant
Shamanic practices require training and guidance
Do not imitate Odin's hanging - symbolic spiritual ordeal only
This entry for mythological study and spiritual contemplation

metadata.note: Cosmological concept rather than botanical plant, but included in herbs as sacred tree

hoverInfo.quick: The immense cosmic ash tree at the center of Norse cosmology, connecting all Nine Realms from roots ...

listDisplay.expandedContent: The immense cosmic ash tree at the center of Norse cosmology, connecting all Nine Realms from roots to crown. Home to gods, humans, giants, elves, dwarves, and the dead. Constantly gnawed by Nidhogg (dragon), watered by Norns, visited by Odin's ravens, and will fall at Ragnar칬k.

sections.title: Description
sections.content: The immense cosmic ash tree at the center of Norse cosmology, connecting all Nine Realms from roots to crown. Home to gods, humans, giants, elves, dwarves, and the dead. Constantly gnawed by Nidhogg (dragon), watered by Norns, visited by Odin's ravens, and will fall at Ragnar칬k.
